main event: Three objects resembling meteors were observed in Glenmora, Louisiana on August 4, 1965.
interesting points: The objects were white-blue in color like a welder's torch., The observation lasted for 5 seconds., No sound or trail was observed from the objects., The estimated altitude of the objects was around 1 mile., The conclusion was that the objects were likely related to a meteor shower.
sighted object: three white-blue objects in the sky
witness description: A civilian, Mr. Conley, 48 years old, works as a laborer.
